Incident.Summary: Attempted robbery of Dollar General staff by male subject armed with knife

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Narrative:
    On 9/26/23 at 1944 hours I responded to the Eden Dollar General located at 31621 Eden Allen Rd, Eden MD 21822, for an armed robbery in progress. I arrived and made contact with cashier and witness Kacie Nicole Parsons, DOB 10/21/01, and employee and secondary witness Kaitlyn Elise Reynolds (née Hughes), DOB 9/23/2000. Kacie advised she had been working at the register when a customer came to the register with a pack of cigarettes and a drink, then brandished a knife within inches of her chest and said, “Give me all the fucking money in your drawer”. Kacie attempted to escape the deadly threat by running away, and the suspect chased after her with the knife in his hand before returning to the register, taking the unpurchased cigarettes, valued at $11.81, and exiting the store.

    Kaitlyn advised she had been working in the rear of the store when she heard Kacie yelling, then saw her running towards her shouting “he has a knife!”. At this time Kaitlyn and Kacie locked themselves in the storage room at the back of the store and called 911.

Kacie provided the following written statement (attached):

I was ringing up customer and when I was done with them the man came up to my register and he placed a purple drink down and asked for cigarettes, Marlboro Menthol 100’s. So I pointed to which ones they were. So when I scanned them, he pulled out a blue pocket knife and says, “give me all the fucking money in your drawer.” So I took a step back and he went around to the register gate and I ran to the self checkout exit. And I ran to the self check out exit [sic]. And I ran to where my coworker was. She was in the back of the store towards the middle. When I was running to her I yelled her name and when I got to her I told her he has a knife and we both ran to the receiving room. I called my manager and my coworker called 911.

Kaitlyn provided the following written statement (attached):

I was in the back of the store stocking and I heard my coworker (Kacie) yelling for me. After I heard my name called I saw a pretty tall height, male, black skin and black hoodie run by me I was told  officers met with him outside he was just a customer but at the time I didn’t know. I asked my coworker (Kacie) from wherever she was “what’s going on?” and all I heard was “he has a knife!” from her I couldn’t tell where she was or the guy I never saw him. When she said that I started to grab my phone to call 911 and ran from the back aisle where I was to our back receiving room and I yelled to Kacie to get back in there with me while I was calling 911. She had made it in the backroom with me and we waited for officers to arrive.

The subject referenced in this statement as “pretty tall height, male, black skin and black” was a prospective customer who can be seen on security footage entering the Dollar General after the robbery transpired and the suspect had exited the store. He was not identified and was promptly removed from the building by Deputy Buhrt of Somerset County Sheriff’s Office upon the deputy’s initial arrival due to the scene not yet being secured.

Security camera footage of this incident was retrieved and investigating troopers provided with a copy on a 32 GB SanDisk USB Flash Drive and secure Google Drive link. 

The footage depicts a heavyset 2/M with short gray hair and heavily tattooed arms wearing blue jeans and a maroon “Milkwaukee” T-shirt who entered the store and began to purchase a drink and a pack of cigarettes at the register staffed by Kacie. After all nearby customers exited the store, the subject removed a folding pocket knife from his pocket, opened it, and thrust the blade within inches of Kacie’s chest while saying something to her. Kacie turned and ran away and the subject chased after her. The subject then slips on the floor, gives up the chase, and returns to steal the pack of cigarettes before walking out the front door. The sales value of the stolen pack of cigarettes at the time of their thet was $11.81. No security footage of the parking lot or store’s exterior was captured.

An on-scene review of the security footage did not reveal suspect contact with any surfaces amenable to evidentiary latent print retrieval. 

Responding officers from allied agencies attempted a K9 track from the suspect’s last known point of egress with negative results in the rainy weather conditions.

Assisting troopers and deputies conducted the following neighborhood check with negative results for any pertinent information or observations related to the incident:

Eden One Stop
31680 Eden Allen Rd

14561 Foltz Dr
William Robinson, 5/14/50

14563 Foltz Dr
Michael Botteon, 11/13/1991

14568 Foltz Dr
Terry Mills, 6/9/72





Case remains open pending further investigation by S/Tpr Corron #6045 of MSP CEDLS.

All events occurred in Somerset County.

Focus of Supplement:
    CED Initial Report/Suspect Charged

Narrative:
    
    On 9/27/23, I S/Tpr. James Corron of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division Eastern Region assumed the investigation.  I sent a request for information bulletin through the local eastern region police agencies to assist in identifying the suspect in the surveillance footage.

    Officer Devin Fairman of the Salisbury Police Department contacted me via telephone and advised he had previously made contact with the suspect on a reported domestic dispute at 1030 Adams Avenue Apartment 2C. Officer Fairman captured the interaction on his agency body worn camera.  Officer Fairman revealed the suspects name was the following;
            Anthony Wayne Adkins
            DOB: 5/12/72
            Maryland ID: MD10272789432
Anthony Wayne was identified through the following;
            Maryland Driver's License photograph
            Store Surveillance footage that matched Officer Fairman’s body camera footage.
           
    Officer Fairman revealed that Anthony Wayne Adkins (hereinafter referred to as Anthony) previously worked for Chesapeake Plumbing. Anthony was checked through Law Enforcement databases and found that he had a non-extraditable warrant from Delaware for unauthorized usage of a motor vehicle for Chesapeake Plumbing’s work vehicle.  Anthony was in possession of Chesapeake Plumbing’s vehicle at which time he had not returned the work vehicle.
Investigators made contact with the Fleet Manager of Chesapeake Plumbing, Michael Culley (hereinafter referred to as Michael) via telephone. Michael stated Anthony had not come to work on Monday or Tuesday and had not returned the work vehicle back to the company.  Michael advised there was a GPS tracker on the work vehicle, and he had tracked the whereabouts of the vehicle.

    On 9/26/23, The GPS locations began at 4912 Snow Hill Road, Salisbury, Maryland at 7:29 p.m and traveled south on Route 13 towards Princess Anne.  The coordinates show the vehicle stopped at 31621 Eden Allen Road, Eden, Maryland at 7:40 p.m. which is where the armed robbery occurred at the Dollar General.  The vehicle then left at 7:44 p.m. which is corroborated via Dollar General Surveillance video. The vehicle continued in and around the Eden, Maryland area and later showed the vehicle stopped at 668 South Salisbury Blvd, Salisbury, MD (WAWA).
 
The work vehicle was shown on camera footage at the Dollar General leaving within a minute of the armed robbery.

    Michael provided various other GPS locations within a few days leading up to the Armed Robbery at the Dollar General which reflected the following:
 
  • 122 South Blvd, Salisbury, Maryland 21801
    • Crazy Louie's Pawn Shop- Rapid Database was checked and did not reveal any pawned tools under Anthony's name.
 
  • 4120 Disharoon Road, Fruitland, Maryland 21826
    • Byrds Consignment

            On 9/29/2023, Investigators applied for charges for Armed Robbery and Assault Second Degree which was returned as an arrest warrant.  The Maryland State Apprehension Team was contacted to assist in locating Anthony.   met with Anthony’s wife Deborah Adkins (hereinafter referred to as Deborah) at her residence located at 1030 Adams Avenue, Apt. 2C, Salisbury, Maryland.  Debbie consented to a search of the residence and revealed no evidence within the residence.  Debbie state Anthony checked into a rehab facility (Gauldenza located in Baltimore) and had taken all of his possessions. 

            Deborah was explained the investigation and was shown a photograph of Anthony inside the Dollar General, and she revealed that the picture was Anthony.  Deborah recognized the necklace around his neck and was familiar with the t-shirt he was wearing.  Deborah confirmed the blue knife was Anthony’s as he carries the knife around most of the time.

            MSAT has taken the warrant that was issued by Somerset County District Court of Maryland and will be following up with the rehab facility and locating Anthony for the active warrant.

Adkins was charged with the following offenses;
  • Assault First Degree
  • Armed Robbery
  • Robbery
  • Assault-Second Degree
  • Reckless Endangerment
  • Dangerous Weapon-INT/INJURE
    Additionally, I spoke with Mike Culley that is the Fleet Manager for Chesapeake Plumbing, and he had advised that some tools were stolen from the work truck once he recovered the van from Adkins.  Mike stated the items were missing after he had inventoried the van.  Mike stated he noticed on the geographical locations of the work vehicle that Adkins drove the work vehicle to Crazy Louie's Pawn Shop in Salisbury, Maryland and a Flea Market located in Fruitland, Maryland.  The Maryland Pawn database was checked and did not reveal Adkins pawning items on the date the work vehicle was at the location.  I will be following up on the Flea Market to attempt to recover any tools that belonged to Chesapeake Plumbing.

GPS locations of Crazy Louie's
  • September 26, 2023 12:36 PM to 12:42 PM 
    • 122 South BLVD, Salisbury, Maryland 21801
GPS location of Byrd's Consignment
  • September 23, 2023, 7:39 AM to 7:52 AM
    • 4120 Disharoon Road, Fruitland, Maryland 21826
  • September 25, 2023 11:37 AM to 11:50 AM
    • 4120 Disharoon Road, Fruitland, Maryland 21826
On September 26, 2023, GPS location coordinated from Eden Allen Road, Maryland and in the surrounding area and ended at the following address;
  • 668 South Salisbury, BLVD, Salisbury, Maryland 
    • WAWA
    The following items were missing from the work vehicle;
  • M18 Inflator
  • M18 Hamm Drill Sawzall Kit w/2batteries
  • M18 Fuel Oscillator multi bare TL
  • AAA 1.5v alk pro-cell battery 24-pk
  • 7 piece plumbers bit kit
  • 8 piece big haw w/carb teeth kit

On October 13, 2023, I conducted an audibly and visually recorded interview of Anthony's brother Nicholas Cleveland Adkins (hereinafter referred to as Nicholas). The interview is not a transcript, therefore some paraphrasing may be used.
  • Nicholas was shown the video surveillance from the Dollar General from his daughter Kaitlin Adkins.
  • Kaitlin Adkins received the video surveillance from Kacie Parsons.
  • Nicholas confirmed it was Anthony in the video that comitted the robbery.
  • Nicholas has no contact with his brother.

I have made arrangements to return the recovered tools to Chesapeake Plumbing.

Case OPEN.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeTitle: Recovery of property from Byrd's Consignment.
IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
The following interaction was captured on my body worn camera (BWC). 

During the course of this investigation it was learned that Anthony Adkins had taken his Chesapeake Plumbing work van, which was equipped with GPS, to Byrd's Consignment located at 4120 Disharoon Road, Eden, MD. 

     On 10/6/23, I responded to 4120 Disharoon Road, Eden, MD and met with the owner, Stephen Byrd (443-523-0138). Byrd advised the following:
  • He knows Anthony Adkins.
  • He bought some tool from Adkins.
  • Adkins was in a plumber's van. 
  • He knows Adkins' wife, Debbie. 
  • He bought a Milwaukee 18 volt tool set in a carry bag and along with some other tools.
  • He still has the Milwaukee 18 volt tool set which he supplied me. 
  • The Milwaukee tools were marked with "Truck #130" 
  • He gave Adkins $150 dollars for the tools.
  • He sold the other tools that he had bought from Adkins. 
  • Adkins said the tools were his and he has bought things from him in the past. 
  • He has video surveillance in the store, but it does not go back that far.
  • He bought the tools from Adkins approximately 1-2 weeks ago. 
  • Adkins was by himself when he came into his store. 
  • I then seized the Milwaukee 18 volt tool set.
I transported the tools back to the Maryland State Police Princess Anne Barrack.

Focus of Supplement:
    Submission of Documents.

Narrative:

  I received documents from the Salisbury Police Department regarding there interaction with Anthony Wayne Adkins.


Case OPEN.

Attachments:
1) MSP 180 Advice of Miranda Rights
2) BWC Footage for Sgt. P. Lane #5164 and S/T S. Maldonado #6171

Narrative:
On October 25, 2023 Southern Region was contacted to assist with an interview of Anthony Wayne Adkins, who had recently been arrested via an open warrant from this investigation. Adkins was interviewed in the Glen Burnie Barrack training room and was read the MSP Form 180 at 1133 hours, which he signed and agreed to answer questions without the assistance of an attorney.  This interview was recorded on my agency issued body worn camera.

Adkins acknowledged previously working for Chesapeake Plumbing and being assigned a company vehicle. Adkins advised that he has been in a rehab facility in Baltimore since October 3, 2023 and does not remember how he got there. He advised that he has had periodic issues with serious drinking that causes him to have blackouts and not remember his actions clearly. Adkins advised he does not recall going to the Dollar General location in Eden and has no memory of committing a crime there. Adkins also denied during follow-up questioning that he pawned any tools from work. 

Adkins did advise that he remembers giving the vehicle back to Chesapeake Plumbing and asked whether anyone was injured by his actions at Dollar General, which he continually denied having any memory of the incident.

Case Closed by arrest.

Focus of Supplement:
    Case Closure.

Narrative:

    On October 25, 2023, I S/Tpr. James Corron of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division Eastern Region received information from the Maryland State Apprehension Team (MSAT) regarding Anthony Wayne Adkins (hereinafter referred to as Anthony).  MSAT arrested Anthony at the Mission Up Rehab Facility in Baltimore, Maryland.  

Case CLOSED.
